episode_summary: This episode of "No Such Thing As A Fish" covers a range of quirky and fascinating facts, including the emotional lives of cows, unusual laws in New York City, safety features in Turkish morgues, and the peculiarities of royal cradle rockers. The hosts delve into these topics with humor and curiosity, exploring the unexpected and often humorous aspects of each fact.

facts.fact: Cows have friends and they get sad when you separate them.
It's illegal to take a selfie with a tiger in New York City.
Morgue refrigerators in Turkey are equipped with motion sensors, alarms, and handles that open them from the inside in case anyone in there wakes up.
Henry VIII had two official cradle rockers who were paid three pounds a year each to rock his cradle.
